meanings.definition: To set within or insert into something else.
meanings.sent1: She carefully began insetting the gem into the ring.
meanings.sent2: The carpenter was insetting the hinges into the door.
meanings.sent3: The chef joked that insetting the secret ingredient would make the dish magical.
meanings.sent4: The artist's brush danced across the canvas, insetting vibrant colors into the painting.
meanings.sent5: The tailor's skilled hands worked quickly, insetting intricate patterns into the fabric.

meanings.definition: The act of setting something within or inserting something into something else.
meanings.sent1: The precise insetting of the diamond into the necklace was flawless.
meanings.sent2: The insetting of the key into the lock was smooth and effortless.
meanings.sent3: The insetting of the puzzle piece completed the picture with a satisfying click.
meanings.sent4: The insetting of the bookshelf into the wall created a seamless look in the room.
meanings.sent5: The insetting of the seeds into the soil marked the beginning of a beautiful garden.
